channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: The black-white US divide in six charts. The results are staggering.
Protesters on US streets for eighth night in a row
Trudeau was asked about Trump's handling of the protests. See how long it took him to respond
item.description: • Trudeau refuses to criticize Trump

item.title: Largely peaceful protests call for justice over George Floyd's death
Video shows Australian police trip and throw down Indigenous teen
item.description: Footage circulated on social media and verified by Australian police shows an officer violently arrest a 17-year-old Indigenous boy. The officer has been placed on restricted duties while authorities review the incident.

item.title: Eight words reveal Republicans' total complicity with Trump
George Floyd's daughter: Daddy changed the world!
item.description: As protests following George Floyd's death in police custody continued for an eighth night across America, Roxie Washington, the mother of his six-year-old daughter, sat down with CNN's Omar Jimenez in Minneapolis.

item.title: The staggering US black-white inequality in 6 charts
Coronavirus patients evacuated ahead of worst storm to hit Mumbai in 70 years
item.description: Coronavirus patients were among more than 100,000 people evacuated from low-lying coastal areas in India's western states as a cyclone advanced toward Mumbai in Maharashtra on Wednesday.

item.title: Similarities between Floyd and Frenchman's deaths spark rage in Paris
item.description: In an echo of the Black Lives Matter protests in the US, protests in Paris were organized by Assa Traoré, whose brother Adama died while being detained by police in 2016. CNN's Melissa Bell reports.

item.title: Twitter says it labels tweets to provide 'context, not fact-checking'
item.description: Twitter has defended its policy of labeling tweets that are potentially misleading or which glorify violence, days after it began applying such warnings to President Donald Trump's posts for the first time.

item.title: Reverend describes being pushed out from church for Trump photo-op
item.description: Rev. Gini Gerbasi, the rector at St. John's Episcopal Church of Georgetown, said she was at the scene when police fired smoke canisters and pepper balls to disperse the crowds so that President Donald Trump could walk over to the church and take photos.

item.title: London arrests for breaking lockdown disproportionately affect black people
Latin America is in crisis. But parts of it are reopening anyway.
Facebook shuts down far-right group planning to bring weapons to protests
item.description: Facebook said Tuesday that it had shut down pages and accounts associated with what it said was a hate group, whose members were discussing bringing weapons to the protests that are happening across the country.

item.title: Zuckerberg struggles to explain inaction on Trump posts to outraged staff
item.description: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg sought to ease the outrage from a number of employees on Tuesday over his inaction on incendiary remarks recently posted by President Donald Trump on the platform.

item.title: Australia suffers first recession in 29 years
item.description: Australia's economy is suffering its first recession in nearly three decades as the nation grapples with the impact of the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: America is in turmoil and stocks are booming. Is the market broken?
Britain's biggest car plant may not survive Brexit
item.description: Britain's biggest car plant has so far weathered the coronavirus pandemic and a major corporate restructuring. But it may not survive Brexit.

item.title: Google removes app that claimed to detect Chinese apps on Indian phones
item.description: Google has removed an app that millions of Indians had downloaded hoping that it would help them boycott Chinese software.

item.title: 9-term Congressman Steve King loses primary after racist comments led to his ostracization
item.description: Nine-term Congressman Steve King of Iowa will lose his Republican primary race to state Sen. Randy Feenstra on Tuesday, CNN projected, after King's racist comments led to his ostracization in Washington and Feenstra mobilized conservative Republicans to his insurgent campaign.

item.title: Late-night hosts mock Trump's bible moment
item.description: Late Night hosts Stephen Colbert, Jimmy Fallon, and Seth Meyers had fun with President Trump's impromptu photo event in front of the St. John's Episcopal Church in Washington.

item.title: Boris Johnson promises UK will provide Hong Kongers path to citizenship after national security fears
item.description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson has promised to provide a path to British citizenship for potentially millions of Hong Kongers, as China prepares to impose a draconian new national security law on the city.

item.title: US companies are 'concerned' about Hong Kong but they're not planning to exit just yet
item.description: American companies are nervous about a contentious national security law planned for Hong Kong and feel pessimistic about the city's medium term future, according to a new survey. But few are considering uprooting their operations in the Asian financial hub just yet.

item.title: 'I don't see racism at all in the NFL,' Denver Broncos head coach says
item.description: Denver Broncos head coach Vic Fangio told reporters Tuesday he doesn't believe racism and discrimination are issues in the NFL.

item.title: Fauci shares optimistic hope on Covid-19 vaccines
item.description: The US should have 100 million doses of one candidate Covid-19 vaccine by the end of the year, Dr. Anthony Fauci, the director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID) and a member of the White House coronavirus task force, said Tuesday.

item.title: On the question of justice, former NBA star Stephen Jackson says 'we've never had it'
item.description: "What's justice?" It's a question that has been troubling former NBA player Stephen Jackson, who was a close friend of George Floyd.

item.title: Flight attendant stunned by passenger's identity after emotional talk
item.description: A Southwest Airlines flight attendant had an emotional conversation about race with a passenger who later revealed he was the CEO of American Airlines.

item.title: In a time of sorrow, black joy needs to be seen as much as black pain. These scientists are showing it, with birds
item.description: Everyone has the bird.

item.title: Protesters tried to remove a Confederate monument in Birmingham. The mayor told them he would finish the job
item.description: The mayor of Birmingham, Alabama, is vowing to remove a 115-year-old Confederate monument from a public park after protesters attempted to tear it down.

item.title: Philippines backtracks on restricting US access to military bases
item.description: The Philippines has reversed its decision to end an important military agreement with the United States as territorial tensions with China heat up in the South China Sea.

item.title: Healthy people shouldn't take daily aspirin to prevent heart disease, review finds
3 generations share their truth about being black in America
Mars' moons may hint that the planet once had rings
item.description: Mars has two small, funky-looking moons with strange orbits, and they may suggest that the red planet once had rings, like some of the larger planets in our solar system.

item.title: We went backpacking with suitcases in Italy and it was a mess
item.description: Like many people, I developed an obsession with Italy relatively early in life. Unlike many people, mine was probably inspired by a cartoon dream sequence in which Yogi Bear and his girlfriend Cindy sailed through Venice on a gondola.

item.title: Austrian architects will transform Hitler's birthplace into a police station
item.description: Austria has unveiled plans to transform Adolf Hitler's birthplace into a police station, following years of debate and legal wrangling over the controversial site.

item.title: The Italian artist imagining eerie futuristic cities
item.description: In Italian artist Giacomo Costa's imagined urban landscapes, shadowy concrete apartment buildings are stacked high, devoid of human presence. In other images he depicts sculptural feats of architecture, their damaged facades eclipsing towering skylines. More of his scenes reveal the husks of buildings overgrown with dense, green plants as woods overtake the remains of empty cities.

item.title: The world lost a field worth of forest every 6 seconds in 2019, analysis says
item.description: New analysis says the world lost an entire football field worth of forest every six seconds in 2019. CNN's Nick Paton Walsh reports from Sao Paulo, Brazil.

item.title: Beyond Meat brings its plant-based burgers to KFC and Pizza Hut in China
item.description: Beyond Meat is expanding its reach in China, one burger at a time.

item.title: 110 million-year-old dinosaur's last meal revealed
item.description: A dinosaur with impressive armored plates across its back became mummified around 110 million years ago after enjoying one last meal before dying.

item.title: Why one man owns 2,371 cell phones
item.description: Jayesh Kale is a collector in India who has spent at least five years gathering cell phones, calling the devices in the collection his "babies."

item.title: A midwife, a train driver and a store worker are British Vogue's latest cover stars
item.description: British Vogue readers might be more familiar seeing supermodels or celebrities gracing its front cover, but July's issue will look a little different, featuring key workers helping provide essential services during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: The surprising origin of Dippin' Dots
item.description: Dippin' Dots—they're an amusement park, zoo, aquarium and overall summertime staple. The mini balls of ice cream that melt in your mouth are also a childhood favorite. But where did the "ice cream of the future" come from?

item.title: These are the issues where disparities are greatest.
item.description: The nationwide protests following the death of a black man, George Floyd, at the hands of white police officers has once again shone a spotlight on the long-standing racial divide in the US.

item.title: Protesters were seen boxed in on the Manhattan Bridge last night. Here's what happened.
No charges for bar owner who shot black protester
item.description: The family of a black man killed by a white bar owner during protests in Omaha, Nebraska, believes a prosecutor rushed to judgment by declaring the shooting an act of self-defense.

item.title: US stocks keep roaring higher despite protests
The cowardice of White House officials, in one quote
item.description: In the wake of President Donald Trump's clearing of peaceful protesters from outside the White House in pursuit of a photo-op -- of him holding a Bible in front of the historic St. John's church -- Axios quoted a "senior White House official" expressing deep dismay with the move.

item.title: Trump and Biden clash as George Floyd's killing jolts 2020 race
item.description: • Analysis: 8 words reveal Republicans' total complicity with Trump • Late-night hosts mock Trump's bible moment

item.title: Retired police captain killed during pawnshop looting
item.description: A retired police captain fatally shot during looting in St. Louis was passionate about helping young people and would have forgiven those behind the violence on the city's streets, his son says.
